channel.title: Help with learning Japanese?
channel.description: I'm trying to find a couple of sites to get me started with this. Anyone mind helping me out a bit?

item.title: Help with learning Japanese?
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:10, topic:342526”]I recommend you learn hiragana as a start, two or three a day maybe. Not sure if http://www.japanesepod101.com/ is decent or not, thats what my friend uses, then again he gets irl lessons as well.[/quote]I’m registered there. But I’m trying to find someone to study it with, so it makes it a little easier.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with learning Japanese?
item.dc:creator: @chri5 chri5
item.description:
@chri5 wrote:

I learnt Spanish with the “Michel Thomas” audio collection. They’re honestly very good.

item.title: Help with learning Japanese?
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

I recommend you learn hiragana as a start, two or three a day maybe. Not sure if http://www.japanesepod101.com/ is decent or not, thats what my friend uses, then again he gets irl lessons as well.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with learning Japanese?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

http://www.freejapaneselessons.com/ may or may not be of some use when learning their alphabet. The first step to any language is learning the alphabet and how their characters are pronounced, and this site covers it well. The second is the grammar, which is also covered.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with learning Japanese?

item.description:

You could learn Japanese at this website: http://www.rscheata.net/forum/index.php loads of chinks there.
[/quote]0/10

But seriously, anyone mind helping me out?[/quote]
what do u mean u got several answers from mopman…

Read full topic

item.title: Help with learning Japanese?
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:5, topic:342526”]You could learn Japanese at this website: http://www.rscheata.net/forum/index.php loads of chinks there.[/quote]0/10

But seriously, anyone mind helping me out?

item.title: Help with learning Japanese?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:4, topic:342526”]rosetta stone is not very good. they have good marketing, thats about it

for learning vocab/kanji: get yourself a spaced repetition software such as Anki and a good dictionary, and follow it as the program suggests (with regards to how many new ones per day etc)

for the “Other people” aspect: http://lang-8.com/

its a website where you can post texts on whatever you want in your target language and people who speak the language either well or natively will tell you what you fucked up and give you tips, theres also a social network of language learners etc

finally, some kind of tape system where you are speaking back to the tape, pimsleur is a goodish intro to most languages, dunno how good their japanese is ive never learned it. michel thomas, assilimil etc are others

how-to-learn-any-language.com has a good forum where tapes&apps and shit are discussed and reviewed[/quote]
i’d love to go on that site and give people bogus answers

Read full topic

item.title: Help with learning Japanese?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

You could learn Japanese at this website: http://www.rscheata.net/forum/index.php loads of chinks there.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with learning Japanese?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

rosetta stone is not very good. they have good marketing, thats about it

for learning vocab/kanji: get yourself a spaced repetition software such as Anki and a good dictionary, and follow it as the program suggests (with regards to how many new ones per day etc)

for the “Other people” aspect: http://lang-8.com/

its a website where you can post texts on whatever you want in your target language and people who speak the language either well or natively will tell you what you fucked up and give you tips, theres also a social network of language learners etc

finally, some kind of tape system where you are speaking back to the tape, pimsleur is a goodish intro to most languages, dunno how good their japanese is ive never learned it. michel thomas, assilimil etc are others

how-to-learn-any-language.com has a good forum where tapes&apps and shit are discussed and reviewed

Read full topic

item.title: Help with learning Japanese?
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“Eh Pretty Easy, post:2, topic:342526”]Get the program ‘Rosetta Stone’, find a torrent or something. Also torrent the Japanese level 1 CD for it, they should give you a good start.[/quote]I already tried that . . . I’m kind of looking for a more interactive approach. And where I can learn with other people.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with learning Japanese?
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

Get the program ‘Rosetta Stone’, find a torrent or something. Also torrent the Japanese level 1 CD for it, they should give you a good start.

Read full topic
